 (i.e. southern side, left)]] The 'Dacians' (, ÎÎ¬Î¿Î¹, ÎÎ¬ÎºÎµÏ}}) were an Indo-
 European people, part of or related to the Thracians. Dacians were the ancient
 inhabitants of Dacia, located in the area in and around the Carpathian
 Mountains and east of there to the Black Sea. This area includes the present-
 day countries of Romania and Moldova, as well as parts of Ukraine, Eastern
 Serbia, Northern Bulgaria, Slovakia, HusovskÃ¡ (1998) 13 Hungary and
 Poland. The Dacians spoke the Dacian language, believed to have been closely
 related to Thracian, but were culturally influenced by the neighbouring
 Scythians and by the Celtic invaders of the 4th century BC. [http://w-
